alert.note: Alert for Denton; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Wise and southwestern Denton Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 1000 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Decatur, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Denton, Flower Mound, Corinth, Decatur, Roanoke, Argyle, Justin, Shady Shores, Northlake, Rhome, Haslet, Bartonville, Copper Canyon, New Fairview, Aurora, Corral City, Ponder, Dish, Stony and Lewisville Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 468 and 469. Interstate 35W between mile markers 68 and 85. Interstate 35E between mile markers 460 and 466. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
